definitions: relating to nerves or the nervous system and its functions
involving artificial networks modeled on biological nervous system structures
examples: Neural pathways carry signals throughout the body
The patient showed extensive neural damage after the accident
The neural network learned to recognize complex patterns
Neural computing has revolutionized artificial intelligence research

definitions: relating to the medical study and treatment of nervous system disorders
examples: The neurologic examination revealed significant motor deficits
She experienced severe neurologic symptoms after the stroke

definitions: relating to the structure, function, and disorders of the nervous system
examples: The neurological assessment took over two hours
Several neurological conditions can cause memory loss

definitions: showing excessive anxiety, obsessive behavior, or emotional instability
relating to or affected by neurosis as a psychological condition
examples: Her neurotic behavior about cleanliness disrupted the household
He became increasingly neurotic about meeting deadlines
The neurotic patient required intensive psychological therapy
Neurotic disorders often respond well to cognitive therapy

definitions: having neither masculine nor feminine grammatical gender in language
lacking developed sexual organs or having been castrated or spayed
examples: German has masculine, feminine, and neuter nouns
The neuter pronoun 'it' refers to inanimate objects
The neuter worker bees cannot reproduce
We adopted a neuter cat from the shelter

definitions: not supporting either side in a conflict or disagreement
having neither acidic nor alkaline chemical properties with pH around seven
having colors like beige, gray, or white without strong chromatic content
describing a gear position where no power is transmitted
examples: Switzerland remained neutral during both world wars
The mediator must maintain a neutral stance throughout negotiations
The solution became neutral after adding the base
Neutral pH is ideal for most aquatic life
She decorated the room in neutral tones
Neutral colors work well with any design scheme
Leave the car in neutral when getting it towed
The engine idles smoothly in neutral gear

definitions: rendered ineffective, harmless, or chemically neutral through counteraction
examples: The threat was completely neutralised by security forces
The acid was neutralised with a strong base

definitions: rendered ineffective, harmless, or chemically neutral through counteraction
examples: The enemy forces were quickly neutralized
The poison was neutralized before causing harm

definitions: recently made, produced, or having come into existence
not previously known, experienced, or encountered by someone
different from or replacing something that existed before
examples: They bought a new car last week
The new building opened downtown yesterday
Everything feels new when you move abroad
She's new to this type of work
We need a new approach to this problem
The new manager has different ideas

definitions: having been born very recently, typically within days or weeks
examples: The newborn baby slept peacefully in her crib
Newborn calves need constant care and attention

definitions: recently discovered, acquired, or achieved, often bringing positive change
examples: She enjoyed her newfound freedom after graduation
His newfound confidence impressed everyone at work

definitions: interesting or important enough to be reported as news
examples: The discovery was considered highly newsworthy by editors
Only newsworthy events make the front page

definitions: coming immediately after the present one in time or sequence
nearest or adjacent in space or position
examples: The next meeting is scheduled for Monday
What happens in the next chapter surprised everyone
She lives in the next apartment
Turn left at the next intersection

definitions: pleasant, enjoyable, or satisfactory in nature or appearance
showing kindness, friendliness, or thoughtful consideration
requiring careful thought or demonstrating subtle distinction
examples: We had a nice time at the beach
The weather was nice for our picnic
She's always nice to everyone she meets
It was nice of you to help
That's a nice distinction between the two concepts
The lawyer made a nice point about precedent

definitions: particularly good, clever, skillful, or stylish in design or execution
examples: That's a nifty solution to the problem
She wore a nifty outfit to the party

definitions: near in space, time, or relation, often used archaically
examples: The end is nigh according to the prophet
Winter was nigh when they finished harvesting

definitions: happening, done, or appearing every night or each night
examples: The nightly news broadcast begins at ten
She follows a strict nightly skincare routine

definitions: extremely unpleasant, frightening, or difficult like a nightmare
examples: The traffic was nightmarish during the holiday weekend
They endured nightmarish conditions in the refugee camp

definitions: rejecting all religious and moral principles, believing life is meaningless
examples: His nihilistic philosophy rejected all traditional values
The novel presents a nihilistic view of modern society

definitions: quick and light in movement, able to move with ease
quick to understand, think, or devise; mentally agile
examples: The nimble gymnast executed perfect flips
Nimble fingers flew across the piano keys
Her nimble mind solved the puzzle instantly
You need nimble thinking in emergency situations

definitions: being one more than eight in number or quantity
examples: She works nine hours every day
The cat has nine lives according to folklore

definitions: being one more than eighteen in number or quantity
examples: She was nineteen years old when she graduated
The nineteenth century saw major industrial changes

definitions: coming after eighteen others in a sequence or series
examples: The nineteenth amendment gave women voting rights
He finished nineteenth in the marathon race

definitions: being ten less than one hundred in number or quantity
examples: The temperature reached ninety degrees yesterday
She lived to be ninety years old

definitions: coming after eight others in a sequence or series
examples: She finished ninth in the competition
The ninth inning proved decisive in the game

definitions: relating to or containing nitrogen, especially in chemical compounds
examples: Nitric acid is highly corrosive and dangerous
The nitric oxide levels were carefully monitored

definitions: relating to or containing nitrogen in a lower valence state
examples: Nitrous oxide is commonly used as dental anesthesia
The nitrous fumes were visible in the air

definitions: having fine personal qualities or high moral principles and ideals
belonging to hereditary aristocracy with high social or political status
being chemically inactive and not readily forming compounds
examples: His noble sacrifice saved many lives
She pursued noble goals throughout her career
The noble families gathered at the palace
Noble titles were inherited through generations
Helium is a noble gas that rarely reacts
Noble metals resist corrosion and oxidation

definitions: active during the night rather than during the day
examples: Owls are nocturnal hunters that sleep during daylight
The nocturnal sounds of the forest kept us awake

definitions: moving the head up and down repeatedly, often showing agreement
examples: The nodding crowd showed their approval
She gave a nodding acknowledgment of his presence

definitions: making a lot of noise or sound that is unpleasant
examples: The noisy neighbors kept everyone awake last night
The restaurant was too noisy for conversation

definitions: living by moving from place to place without permanent settlement
examples: The nomadic tribes follow their herds across the plains
She lived a nomadic lifestyle for several years

definitions: existing in name only but not in reality or substance
being very small or far below real value or cost
relating to nouns or used as a noun in grammar
examples: He was the nominal leader with no real power
The company maintains nominal control over operations
They charge a nominal fee for membership
The damage was nominal and easily repaired
The nominal phrase functions as the sentence subject
Nominal forms can be derived from verbs

definitions: formally proposed as a candidate for election or honor
examples: The nominated candidates will debate next week
She was nominated for three Academy Awards

definitions: denoting the grammatical case used for the subject of a verb
examples: The nominative case indicates the sentence subject
In Latin, nominative endings vary by declension

definitions: not having commerce or profit as the primary aim
examples: The noncommercial radio station relies on donations
They organized a noncommercial community event

definitions: denoting military personnel who have not received a commission
examples: The noncommissioned officer led the training exercise
Noncommissioned personnel make up most military forces

definitions: failing to conform to prevailing standards, rules, or conventions
examples: The nonconforming products were removed from shelves
Nonconforming behavior often faces social resistance

definitions: not following accepted customs, beliefs, or practices
examples: Her nonconformist style challenged fashion norms
The nonconformist artist refused traditional techniques

definitions: lacking distinctive or interesting features, characteristics, or qualities
examples: He wore a nondescript gray suit to blend in
The nondescript building was easy to overlook

definitions: not existing in reality or not present in a particular place
examples: Customer service was practically nonexistent at that store
The funding for the project is nonexistent

definitions: not belonging to or characteristic of humans beings
examples: Scientists study nonhuman primate behavior extensively
The story features both human and nonhuman characters

definitions: not involving the introduction of instruments into the body
examples: The doctor recommended noninvasive treatment options first
Noninvasive procedures typically have shorter recovery times

definitions: not arranged in or following a straight line or simple progression
examples: The novel uses a nonlinear narrative structure
Nonlinear equations require complex mathematical solutions

definitions: not biased toward any political party or group
examples: The nonpartisan commission oversees election procedures
She maintained a nonpartisan stance throughout debates

definitions: not making or intended to make profit for distribution
examples: The nonprofit organization relies entirely on donations
She works for a nonprofit environmental group

definitions: not affiliated with or restricted to a particular religious group
examples: The nonsectarian school welcomes students of all faiths
They established a nonsectarian charitable foundation

definitions: having no meaning or making no logical sense
examples: That's a nonsense argument with no basis
The nonsense words confused the children

definitions: having no meaning or conveying absurd or ridiculous ideas
examples: His nonsensical explanation confused everyone present
The nonsensical rules made the game impossible

definitions: not specific, detailed, or identified with a particular thing
examples: The patient reported nonspecific symptoms like fatigue
His nonspecific complaints made diagnosis difficult
